person.persName: Marie Le Fevre, Yvonne Le Fevre, & Georgette Normand

div1.p: IN THE UNITED STATES CIRCUIT COURT FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
In the Matter of the Application of James P. Lavin and Sister Superior M. Angelique, for a Writ of Certiorari} No. 1078 Assignment of Errors.
In the matter of the Application of Yvonne Le Fevre, Georgette Normand and Marie Le Fevre for a Writ of Habeas Corpus

The petitioners in this action, James P. Lavin and Sisiter Superior M, Angelique in connection with their appeal by their Attorney, Edward E. Cushman, Assistant United States Attorney, make the following assignment of errors, which occupied upon the trial and in this cause.

1st. The court is its order and judgment of Februrary 19th erred in concluding as a matter of law, that the only ection warranted by the respondent your petitioners) and the goverment and its officers under the facts disclosed by the retun, was the return of the applicats for habeas corpus to Victoria, B.C.
2nd. The court erred in its said order and judgment in attaching the condition to the order of remand directing your petitioner to what country to retun the applicats for habeas corpus.

3rd. The court furhter erred after the showing made by the supplementary return, that the Secretary of the Tresury had made and issued his warant of deportation of said applicats to France in refusing to modify its judgment and order of February 19th, and simply made its judgment and order of February applicats tothe custody of James P. Lavin

4th. THe court further erred in assuming authority and jurisdiction to determine and adjudge to what country or countries the applicats should be depoted after the showing made in the supplementary return; that the Secretary of the Tresury had excercised his authority and jurisdiction on that question.

Wherefore, petitioners pray that the foregoing errors be corrected; that said judgment be reversed and modified so as to be simply a judgment remending the applicants for writ of habeas corpus to the custody of James P. Lavin, your petitioner, or his sucessor in office.
Edward E Cushman Assistant United States Attorney.
In the Circuit Court of the United States & In District of Washington
James P. Lavin & et all Suspends the Appeallents vs Yvonne Le Fevre et al Respondents
FILED IN THE U.S. Circuit Court DIST. OF WASHINGTON. MAR 5 1903 A. REEVES AYRES, Clerk HM Statiherd Dep.
